Ian White (CTO & Founder) | homepage = https://www.sailthru.com/ }} '''Sailthru''' is a Smart Data company with an international client base.{{citeweb|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/sailthru-series-b-funding-2013-2|title=Sailthru raises $19 million for using big data respectfully|author=Nissen, Max|date=Feb. 11, 2013|publisher=Business Insider|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}}{{citeweb|url=http://www.venturestud.io/neil-capel-ceo-of-sailthru/|title=Neil Capel, CEO at Sailthru – video interview|author=Lerner, Dave|date=Sept. 23, 2011|publisher=Venture Studio|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}} Based in [[New York City]], the company’s Smart Data solution makes automated decisions based on user activity across clients’ [[websites]], [[email]], and [[mobile applications]].{{citeweb|url=http://www.crunchbase.com/company/sailthru|title=Profile: Sailthru|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}}{{citeweb|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/sailthru-raises-8-million-round-led-by-rre-ventures-2011-9#ixzz1YW5yqxts|title=Smart email provider Sailthru raises $8 million round led by RRE Ventures|author=Shontell, Alyson|date=Sept. 20, 2011|publisher=Business Insider|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}}{{citeweb|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/sailthru-funding-2010-7|title=Behavioral email startup Sailthru raises $1 million led by DFJ Gotham|author=Frommer, Dan|date=July 26, 2010|publisher=Business Insider|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}} ==Founders== Neil Capel is the founder and current CEO of Sailthru.{{citeweb|url=http://www.linkedin.com/in/neilcapel|title=Linked In, Neil Capel|publisher=Linked In |accessdate=April 10, 2013|}} Capel graduated from the [[University of Portsmouth]] in the U.K. with a BSc in computer science. A British citizen, Capel worked as a coder before beginning work at [[Morgan Stanley]] in 2000. The company transferred him to New York, where he left Morgan Stanley to become Chief Executive Officer at Redscope LLC. From 2003 until 2009, Capel worked as Chief Technical Officer for several companies, including Money-Media and Music Nation. Capel is Chief Executive Officer at Sailthru and also advisor to [[Refinery29]] and Replyforall. Ian White is the co-founder and CTO of Sailthru. White graduated from [[Brown University]] with a dual major in [[computer science]] and theatre.{{citeweb|url=http://www.linkedin.com/in/neilcapel|title=Linked In, Ian White|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}} He also holds an MFA in theatre from Brown. From 2005, he served as developer at Money-Media and Music Nation. In 2008, he became lead developer for [[Business Insider]], eventually becoming its technical adviser in 2010. His hobbies include, maintaining an acting career in off-Broadway plays and taking part in the Brooklyn Generator, a monthly playwriting and production event.{{citeweb|url=http://upstart.bizjournals.com/entrepreneurs/hot-shots/2012/12/18/ian-white-of-sailthru-on-audiences.html?page=all|title=Thespian CTO creates dramatic vision|author=del Castillo, Michael|date=Dec. 18, 2012|publisher=Upstart Business Journal|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}} ==History== Working with co-founder Ian White, Capel funded the company through its first year out of his own pocket. In 2010, he sought and obtained $1 million in seed funding. A year later, Series A investors provided the company with $8 million in additional funding. The latest Series B funding round in 2013 raised $19 million, with Benchmark joining core investors AOL Ventures, [[RRE Ventures]] and DFJ Gotham Ventures. The company will expand its production development, account management and marketing staff as well as infrastructure to expand into Fortune 500 companies.{{citeweb|url=http://www.finsmes.com/2013/02/sailthru-raises-19m-series-funding.html |title=Sailthru raises $19 million in Series B funding|date=Feb. 11, 2013|publisher=Finsmes|accessdate=April 10, 2013|}} In 2013 Sailthru opened an office in [[San Francisco, CA]]. ==Products== Sailthru is a Smart Data platform that lets businesses make real-time automated decisions for optimizing their customers’ experiences across email communication, websites, and mobile apps. The platform tracks user preferences and behavior on clients’ websites, email, and apps, and generates large datasets and unique profiles to help clients customize communications and develop [[advertising]] targeted to each user. Sailthru’s products include [[Concierge]], a tool that provides targeted pop-out recommendations through their Horizon technology, Scout, a personalized webpage that recommends personalized content, and AdFlight, an automated email ad campaign tool. ==External Links== *https://www.sailthru.com/ ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Communication]] [[Category:Media technology]] [[Category:Telecommunications]]
